stepTitle: The exposure index EI for a camera is a measurement of the amount of light that hits the image receptor. It is determined by the equation $$EI=\operatorname{log2}\left(\frac{f^2}{t}\right)$$, where f is the “f-stop” setting on the camera, and $$t$$ is the exposure time in seconds. Suppose the f-stop setting is $$8$$ and the desired exposure time is $$2$$ seconds. What will the resulting exposure index be?
